title: How to watch Brooklyn Nine-Nine season 8 online from anywhere
author: alex-hughes
summary: Lock and load for the final ever episode of B99
article: Grab a box of tissues and a yoghurt to toast Terry as season 8 marks the last instalment of our favorite cop comedy. From copious sex tape title jokes to the last of the Jimmy Jabs, here's how to watch Brooklyn Nine-Nine season 8 online from anywhere.

Not many shows have had fans go to battle for them, but Brooklyn Nine-Nine has certainly been through the wars as its original network, Fox, dropped it, only for NBC to pick it up the next day following outcry. However, it's time to bid farewell to the 99th Precinct as the cast hand over their metaphorical badge and gun in the sitcom's eighth and final season. And it looks as though all our questions will be answered, wrapping on our beloved Jake, Amy, Rosa, Holt, and the rest.
How will Jake and Amy handle having a baby? Will Holt get promoted to commissioner?

Fans can be reassured of a satisfying ending, though, with the directors, Michael Schur and Dan Goor, experts in this field. Between the two of them they've helped write or direct Parks and Recreations, The Good Place, episodes of The Office, SNL and a host of other TV classics.
Ready for one last ride? We've listed everything you need to know about how to watch Brooklyn Nine-Nine season 8 online where you are.

Happen to be out of the country when this final season of Brooklyn Nine-Nine airs? No problem, while you'll find the content is geo-blocked when you try and tune in, you can still catch all of the action via a VPN.

A VPN allows you to watch your favorite show from anywhere in the world. It does this by changing your IP address to one in the country you live in normally. Here's everything you need to know to get started:
Three simple steps to using a VPN to bypass geo-restrictions:
1. Download and install a VPN - our recommendation is ExpressVPN
2. Connect to the relevant server location - launch the VPN app, click on 'choose location' and select the right location, i.e. US for Hulu, or Australia for SBS' free stream
3. Head to the chosen broadcaster's live stream - so if you're from Australia, just head to SBS On Demand
